name: listEvery
syntax: listEvery(list, closure [, delimiter] [, includeEmptyFields] [, multiCharacterDelimiter] [, parallel] [, maxThreads])
member: list.listEvery(closure [, delimiter] [, includeEmptyFields] [, multiCharacterDelimiter] [, parallel] [, maxThreads])
description: This function calls a given callback function for every element in a given string list and returns true, if all of the calls returns true.

params.name: closure
params.description:
Callback function that is called for every item of the list and returns a boolean value. The arguments passed to the callback are

value: Current list item
index: Index of the list item within the list
list: List as defined in the 'list' parameter
delimiter: Delimiter as defined in the 'delimiter' parameter

params.name: delimiter
params.description: Delimiter used to separate the string list.

params.name: includeEmptyFields
params.description: Specifies whether to include empty fields or not.

params.name: multiCharacterDelimiter
params.description: Specifies whether the 'delimiter' parameter specifies a multi-character delimiter. If it is set to `true`, all characters are considered as one delimiter; otherwise each character is a delimiter on its own.

params.name: parallel
params.description: Specifies whether to execute closures in parallel.

params.name: maxThreads
params.description: Maximum number of threads executed, ignored when argument 'parallel' is set to false.

examples.title: Example for positive result
examples.description: Checks whether all items in a list are greater than 2 and outputs true because all of them fulfill the requirement.
examples.code:
list = '4,5,6,7';
writeOutput(listEvery(list, function(value) { return value gt 2; }));

examples.title: Example for negative result
examples.description: Checks whether all items in a list are greater than 2 and outputs false because some of them do not fulfill the requirement.
examples.code:
list = '1,2,3,4';
writeOutput(listEvery(list, function(value) { return value gt 2; }));
